revisionDesc.change: changed choice encoding 'Vanvories' to 'Vorhees'; corrected choice encoding 'st louis'
Revise year to 1870 in date note; annotate Vorhees
Proofreading Corrections: Heyde dates and Silent Proof
Clean encoding (editor, date, remove "_large") and add standard annotations on unannotated files (Jeff W, Martha [Mattie], George W, Lou Haslam)

body.p:
we are permitted to see another rainy day but rather warm i am so glad waltWalt to hear you say you are so well i got your letter to day and the book came all safe i was very glad to have it i have read it partly through and like it very much i stay at home so much that i want something to read i shall show georgeGeorgey the letter about the interest he always gives me some money when he comes but he has had so much to pay every time he has been home that i dident didn't ask him for as much as i should if he hadent hadn't had so much to pay the taxes was i think 180 doller dollars and he has to have money
to pay his expencesexpenses walterWalter you go around so much you must get some new cloths clothes i think that gray satinet would make you a couple of pairs of pantaloons and vest but i dont don't think you would like it for a coat i think the pantaloons should be lined with thin muslin walterWalter i gess guess you dont don't want to see me more than i doo do you) i have just been reading about vanvoriesVorhees the ex supervisor that was shot sunday Sunday night in south brooklyn Brooklyn you will see it i suppose in the papers)
i am glad you wrote to han and sent her the harpers Harper's i get it every saturdaySaturday) you must tell me when you write how many valentines you got

postscript.p: i havent haven't heard from st louisSt. Louis
